intro: Sanicula europaea var. genuina, commonly known as European sanicle, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
